image.altText: Xi Jinping smiles over his shoulder as he looks at Donald Trump.uring a

props.synopsis: The United States last tested a nuclear weapon in 1992, and appears to be making the move in reaction to Russia successfully testing a Poseidon nuclear-powered super torpedo.

title.children: Trump to reduce tariffs on Beijing amid resumed US nuclear weapons testing

image.altText: A children's toy bear laying sideways on a floor.

props.synopsis: Parents are demanding answers from centre operators after their children were allegedly sexually abused by other children while in child care.

title.children: Are these kids just 'exploring their bodies' or is it something more sinister?

image.altText: Albanese Trump dinner

props.synopsis: As the US president promises South Korea can have nuclear submarines, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese insists this can be delivered alongside the AUKUS boats.

title.children: Albanese confident on AUKUS despite Trump's Korean subs promise

image.altText: A picture of a military-style boat

props.synopsis: Almost four weeks after a $25 million Australian-gifted patrol boat ran aground on a reef while ferrying government officials, the Vanuatu government has yet to reveal the circumstances around the grounding, saying "an investigation is continuing".

title.children: Questions over Australian-gifted patrol boat smashed on reef during 'VIP transport'

image.altText: barnaby

props.synopsis: The prominent Nationals MP, who is taking time away from his party, says he will respect the formal process into the allegation but denies it.

title.children: Barnaby Joyce denies allegation he yelled at staffer

image.altText: A smiling teenager with cricket pictures in the background

props.synopsis: The family of Ben Austin, who died after being struck by a ball during cricket practice in Melbourne earlier this week, issues a statement mourning the 17-year-old and saying their thoughts are with the teammate involved in the incident.

title.children: Family mourns 'shining light' teenager who died after cricket accident

image.altText: Smiling older woman wearing glasses.

props.synopsis: An 80-year-old cruise ship passenger who was found dead on Lizard Island in Far North Queensland on the weekend has been identified as Sydney woman Suzanne Rees.

title.children: Family shocked after mum 'dies alone' on tropical island during cruise

image.altText: Marielle Smith stands up in senate question time.

props.synopsis: Senate Question Time ends in chaos as the government responds to an opposition and crossbench move to add more questions to the parliamentary session. Follow live.

title.children: Chaotic end to Senate QT as Labor responds to opposition, crossbench revolt

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Ask not for whom the division bell tolls
An unusual alliance in the Senate
Senate urges government to review oral health accessibility for cancer survivors

image.altText: James Hardie logo on Sydney building

props.synopsis: James Hardie investors have ousted the company's chair and several directors in a backlash against a controversial takeover deal. The US central bank cut interest rates overnight but it wasn't a unanimous decision. Follow live.

title.children: James Hardie shares fall as angry shareholders oust chair

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Australian shares end lower despite reports of US-China trade deal
Wesfarmers shares falls over 7pc despite $2.7bn net profit
Trump: 'We have a deal' with China

image.altText: Sussan Ley

props.synopsis: In a week when Labor earned a poor scorecard for its transparency, the Coalition was wasting time responding to yet another self-inflicted saga.

title.children: Coalition split but this time it's over a T-shirt, not net zero

image.altText: crypto atm scam victim Dorothy Dyall, Oct 2025

props.synopsis: A pensioner tells her nightmarish story as the financial crimes regulator takes action against a second Australian player in the booming crypto ATM business linked to lucrative scams and money laundering.

title.children: A computer alarm, scam calls, then Dorothy's life savings were gone

image.altText: A life-size bust of Julius Caesar.

props.synopsis: An investigation into how nine schools taught the wrong topic for a year 12 exam will probe why a report about another school making the same error two months ago was not further examined.

title.children: Investigation widens into Queensland exam bungle after warning ignored

image.altText: A man with long white hair looks down at his phone while walking down the steps of a court building.

props.synopsis: A Perth businessman who defrauded clients of more than $34 million in what was described as a "Ponzi scheme" has been sentenced to 14 years in prison.

title.children: Ponzi-scheme fraudster who conned $34 million from investors jailed for 14 years

image.altText: Ryan stands in front of his organic and sleek modern passive house that's all concrete, big windows, with surprising boulders.

props.synopsis: Five months after Ryan Moody moved into his passive house, we check in to see if the hard work was worth it — and what everyday Australians can take from passive house principles.

title.children: The pros, cons and misconceptions about passive houses

image.altText: A close up shot of police tape with cars parked on a street and trees blurred in the background

props.synopsis: Police are investigating after an eight-month-old baby was found dead at a home in Perth's southern suburbs.

title.children: Breaking: Police treating death of baby in Perth's south as 'suspicious'

image.altText: A boy holds his hands to his face as sits among the contents of a home that has apparently been destroyed.

props.synopsis: Despite more than 100 Palestinians being killed by Israel in little more than 12 hours, the ceasefire continues to hold, though that technicality does not mean much to those on the ground.

title.children: Israel's latest strikes highlight a difficult truth about the Gaza ceasefire

image.altText: image of whale caracass with netting around its tail from aerial view

props.synopsis: A video appearing to show a person climbing on a humpback whale found dead, entangled in a shark net in NSW, has been criticised by a marine rescue group.

title.children: 'Confronting' video of person on dead humpback whale shocks volunteer

image.altText: Utes lined up blocking a track to the sea

props.synopsis: Oyster farmers have formed a blockade at Haslam in South Australia to prevent oysters from an area affected by the algal bloom being put in the waters around Streaky Bay.

title.children: Oyster farmers blockade trucks carrying oysters from algal bloom waters

image.altText: Three men sit with their heads bowed in chairs in front of three judges.

props.synopsis: A trial has begun in Bali for three Australian men accused of killing a Melbourne father in an alleged premeditated hit.

title.children: Trial begins for three Australians accused of killing a man in Bali villa

image.altText: A worker in high-vis stands next to the interior of a ship hull showing crossbeams of metal.

props.synopsis: From wharfless ferries to bungled design specifications costing millions, the troubled Spirit of Tasmania ship replacement project saga just keeps rolling on.

title.children: How Tasmania's ferry operator made a multi-million-dollar mistake

image.altText: The outside of Cessnock Correctional Complex building with fence in the background

props.synopsis: Thousands of New South Wales prison officers walk off the job over the sentence handed to a prisoner who bashed four guards at Cessnock Correctional Complex.

title.children: Thousands of NSW prison officers strike over sentence for guard bashings

image.altText: A sketch of a man with grey hair and glasses in a grey jacket, white collared shirt and dark tie.

props.synopsis: A woman who lived next to two women who were murdered nearly 50 years ago in Melbourne has told a court about the day she discovered their bodies.

title.children: Court hears from victims' former neighbour in Easey St murder hearing

image.altText: Donald Trump and Lee Jae Myung smile while shaking hands near a massive gold crown

props.synopsis: From menus featuring ketchup and American beef to the gifting of a massive replica gold crown, Donald Trump's visit to South Korea was carefully crafted to please the US president.

title.children: A gold crown, ketchup and the YMCA: Trump's warm welcome to South Korea

image.altText: Adeang and Albanese shake hands and smile inside the prime minister's office at parliament house.

props.synopsis: The federal government has refused to release a translation of an interview with Nauruan president David Adeang concerning a deal with Australia to deport hundreds of people, despite the Nauruan government publishing the video on Facebook.

title.children: Government withholds translated public interview about opaque Nauru deal

image.altText: Tim Ayres

props.synopsis: The government can't hide its frustration with Rio Tinto, but at the same time it's preparing to dip deeper into taxpayers' pockets to help the company out. Again.

title.children: Labor digging into taxpayers' pockets to bail out Rio Tinto again

image.altText: An armed soldier and hospital workers unload bodies at a hospital while a crowd looks on

props.synopsis: Brazil's deadliest ever police operation has triggered protests against the use of excessive force and calls for Rio's governor to resign.

title.children: Rio de Janeiro drug raid leaves at least 120 dead

image.altText: Kamala Harris looks at Joe Biden as he speaks from a presidential lectern.

props.synopsis: Richard Nixon did what Kamala Harris wants to. But for her to get to the White House, she is going to have to make tough decisions she has failed to in the past.

title.children: Joe Biden was exposed by his frailties. They're still exposing Kamala Harris

image.altText: An arrangement of 20 different sunscren products on a background of pink bathroom tiles.

props.synopsis: The Australian sunscreen manufacturer at the centre of a spate of recent product recalls has been blocked from exporting sunscreens to the United States for the past three years.

title.children: Sunscreen maker at centre of recalls blocked by US regulator for years

image.altText: A woman looks seriously at the camera

props.synopsis: The Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence Commission found systems meant to keep governments accountable are so fragmented they are leading to authorities passing the buck on responsibility.

title.children: National watchdog needed for violence against women, commissioner says

image.altText: Lynda Henderson aged care

props.synopsis: With major changes to the aged care system looming this week, price hikes for older people accessing support at home could mean their aged care packages will not stretch as far.

title.children: Seniors risk losing some at-home services in Support at Home roll out

image.altText: A woman looks seriously down the barrel of a camera.

props.synopsis: A woman, who was unable to call triple-0 after men broke into her home while she was in her bedroom, is demanding answers from the telco as calls ramp up for a complete overhaul of the system.

title.children: Melbourne woman saw robber but could not call police using triple-0

image.altText: Photo of Gus

props.synopsis: The dam has been previously searched by divers, but draining it will allow a "comprehensive visual search" to be completed, police say.

title.children: SA Police to drain dam in renewed search for missing 4yo Gus

image.altText: Australia celebrates wicket

props.synopsis: Australia is looking to continue a near-perfect tournament in Thursday's Women's ODI World Cup semifinal. This is all you need to know ahead of the blockbuster clash in Mumbai.

title.children: Can India find a way to upset Australia's staggering all-round depth?
